items.abstract: <jats:p>It is shown that if<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="$X$" id="E1"><mml:mi>X</mml:mi></mml:math>is a Banach space and<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="$C$" id="E2"><mml:mi>C</mml:mi></mml:math>is a union of finitely many nonempty, pairwise disjoint, closed, and connected subsets<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="$\{C_i: 1\leq i\leq n\}$" id="E3"><mml:mrow><mml:mrow><mml:mo>{</mml:mo><mml:mrow><mml:msub><mml:mi>C</mml:mi><mml:mi>i</mml:mi></mml:msub><mml:mo>:</mml:mo><mml:mn>1</mml:mn><mml:mo>≤</mml:mo><mml:mi>i</mml:mi><mml:mo>≤</mml:mo><mml:mi>n</mml:mi><mml:mtext> </mml:mtext></mml:mrow><mml:mo>}</mml:mo></mml:mrow></mml:mrow></mml:math>of<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="$X$" id="E4"><mml:mi>X</mml:mi></mml:math>, and each<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="$C_i$" id="E5"><mml:mrow><mml:msub><mml:mi>C</mml:mi><mml:mi>i</mml:mi></mml:msub></mml:mrow></mml:math>has the fixed-point property (FPP) for asymptotically regular nonexpansive mappings, then any asymptotically regular nonexpansive self-mapping of<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="$C$" id="E6"><mml:mi>C</mml:mi></mml:math>has a fixed point. We also generalize the Goebel-Schöneberg theorem to some Banach spaces with Opial's property.</jats:p>
title: Fixed points of asymptotically regular nonexpansive mappings on nonconvex sets

items.abstract: <jats:p>The article presents the results of the analysis of Świderian culture materials from Żuławka, site 13, com. Wyrzysk, with the refitting method applied. The refitting blocks have been analysed twice, from different points of view. The first study, in 2003, concentrated on spatial relations between areas of activities, while the second analysed technological aspects. The article aims to present unpublished results of the study.</jats:p>
